parsetree.*:
<root><template><title>Command</title><part><name>Comments</name>=<value>
____________________________________________________________________________________________

</value></part><part><name index="1"/><value> arma </value></part><part><name>Game name</name>=<value>

</value></part><part><name index="2"/><value>1.00</value></part><part><name>Game version</name>=<value>

</value></part><part><name>arg</name>=<value> local </value></part><part><name>MPARGUMENTS</name>=<value>

</value></part><part><name>gr1</name>=<value> Unit Control </value></part><part><name>GROUP1</name>=<value>
____________________________________________________________________________________________

</value></part><part><name index="3"/><value> Return expected destination of unit as an array.</value></part><part><name>DESCRIPTION</name>=<value>
____________________________________________________________________________________________

</value></part><part><name index="4"/><value> [[Array]] <ext><name>nowiki</name><attr/><inner>=</inner><close></nowiki></close></ext> '''expectedDestination''' person </value></part><part><name>SYNTAX</name>=<value>

</value></part><part><name>p1</name>=<value> person: [[Object]]  </value></part><part><name>PARAMETER1</name>=<value>

</value></part><part><name index="5"/><value> [[Array]] in form:
*0: [[Position]]
*1: planningMode
*2: forceReplan</value></part><part><name>RETURNVALUE</name>=<value>

</value></part><part><name>x1</name>=<value><code>_data = [[expectedDestination]] [[player]];</code></value></part><part><name>EXAMPLE1</name>=<value> 
____________________________________________________________________________________________

</value></part><part><name index="6"/><value> [[setDestination]] </value></part><part><name>SEEALSO</name>=<value>

</value></part></template>

<h3 style="display:none">Notes</h3>
<dl class="command_description">
<comment><!-- Note Section BEGIN -->
</comment>
<dd class="notedate">Posted on 16:24, 3 March 2007 (CET) 
<dt class="note">[[User:Donnervogel|Donnervogel]]<dd class="note">For AI units I have found the following values: ''planningMode'' is "LEADER PLANNED" when the unit is ordered by the group leader to go somewhere or if the unit is the group leader and it follows a waypoint. Otherwise ''planningMode'' it is "DoNotPlan". Units moving in formation have "DoNotPlan" as long as they don't receive orders by the group leader. Units also have "DoNotPlan" when they don't move. Units executing special formation tasks like engaging or return to formation have "FORMATION PLANNED" as long they haven't fulfilled the task.

<comment><!-- Note Section END -->
</comment></dl>
